title: 112_hr4373
content: The Act may be cited as the "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" and includes expanded tax benefits for adoption made permanent. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" includes permanent expansions for adoption tax benefits. This includes an increase in the dollar limitation for the adoption credit from $10,000 to $13,170. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" increases the adoption credit from $10,000 to $13,170, including a credit for adopting a child with special needs. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" raises the adoption credit from $10,000 to $13,170 and adjusts for inflation in subsection (h) of section 23 of the Code. Beginning after December 31, 2010, dollar amounts in subsections (a)(3) and (b)(1) will be increased by a cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. "In the case of a taxable year beginning after December 31, 2002, any increased amount not a multiple of $10 shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The dollar amount in subsection (b)(2)(A)(i) will be increased by the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins." The taxable year begins with a substitution for calendar year 1992 in 2001. Dollar limitation for adoption assistance programs is amended from $10,000 to $13,170. Amounts not multiples of $10 are rounded to the nearest multiple. The dollar limitation for adoption assistance programs is increased from $10,000 to $13,170. The exclusion for adoption of a child with special needs is also amended to reflect this new limit. The dollar limitation for adoption assistance programs is increased from $10,000 to $13,170, with a conforming amendment to inflation adjustment. In taxable years after December 31, 2010, dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) will be adjusted for inflation based on the cost-of-living adjustment. "In taxable years after December 31, 2010, dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) will be adjusted for inflation based on the cost-of-living adjustment. For taxable years beginning after December 31, 2002, the income limitation amount in subsection (b)(2)(A) will be increased by the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins." "In taxable years after December 31, 2010, dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) will be adjusted for inflation. The income limitation amount in subsection (b)(2)(A) for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2002, will be increased by the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. Section 1(f)(3) determines the taxable year under specific conditions, with amounts rounded to the nearest multiple of $10." The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to redesignate section 23 as section 36C and move it to a new location before section 37. Section 24(b)(3)(B) is amended by removing reference to section 23. Section 24(b)(3)(B), 25(e)(1)(C), 25A(i)(5)(B), 25B(g)(2), and 26(a)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are all amended by removing references to section 23. Section 25B(g)(2), 26(a)(1), 30(c)(2)(B)(ii), 30B(g)(2)(B)(ii), and 30D(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are all amended by removing references to section 23. Section 30D(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended by removing references to section 23 and making other related amendments. Section 36C is also amended by removing certain paragraphs and subsections. Section 137 is amended by updating references in subsection (d). Section 36C is amended by updating references in subsections (d) and (e), as well as in subsections (g) and (i) of other sections of the Internal Revenue Code. Section 36C is amended by updating references in subsections (d) and (e), as well as in subsections (g) and (i) of other sections of the Internal Revenue Code. Additionally, various sections of the Code are amended by striking and inserting specific references to align with the changes made to section 36C. Section 23 is amended by inserting "36C," after "36B," in section 1324(b) of title 31, United States Code. The table of sections for subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is updated to include a new item after section 36B. The amendments made by section 36C relate to adoption expenses and are effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2011.
